item.title: Reuters reveals Germany’s Speira set to win EU nod for RAB deal with asset sale offer
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters was first to report private equity firm KPS Capital Partners’ German aluminium smelter Speira is set to gain European […]

The post Reuters reveals Germany’s Speira set to win EU nod for RAB deal with asset sale offer appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters was first to report private equity firm KPS Capital Partners’ German aluminium smelter Speira is set to gain European Union (EU) antitrust approval for its plan to buy aluminium recycler Real Alloy Europe with its offer to sell two plants to address EU concerns.

The post Reuters reveals Germany’s Speira set to win EU nod for RAB deal with asset sale offer appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals scores of Google rivals want EU tech law used in antitrust case
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters exclusively revealed more than 40 European rivals to Google’s shopping service urged European Union (EU) antitrust regulators to use […]

The post Reuters reveals scores of Google rivals want EU tech law used in antitrust case appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively revealed more than 40 European rivals to Google’s shopping service urged European Union (EU) antitrust regulators to use newly adopted tech rules to ensure the Alphabet unit complies with a 2017 EU order to allow more competition on its search page. The European Commission fined Google 2.4 billion euros five years ago and told the firm to stop favouring its shopping service.

The post Reuters reveals scores of Google rivals want EU tech law used in antitrust case appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals U.S. judge approves sales process for shares in Citgo Petroleum’s parent company
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters was first to report that a U.S. judge approved an auction process that could lead to the breakup of […]

The post Reuters reveals U.S. judge approves sales process for shares in Citgo Petroleum’s parent company appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters was first to report that a U.S. judge approved an auction process that could lead to the breakup of Venezuela owned Citgo Petroleum, the seventh-largest  U.S. oil refiner. Two years after first authorizing a sale of shares in Citgoâs parent company, PDVSA, the judge set bidding procedures and a calendar that could see a high bid accept within nine months to satisfy a $970 million judgment won by a Canadian miner over the expropriation of its assets in Venezuela. Reuters also revealed four other companies with $4.3 billion in combined claims against Venezuela â ConocoPhillips, Koch-related mineral and nitrogen companies, Gold Reserve Inc. and U.S. holders of defaulted Venezuelan bonds â  were seeking to have their own judgments registered with the same court. 

The post Reuters reveals U.S. judge approves sales process for shares in Citgo Petroleum’s parent company appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals chip toolmaker KLA to stop sales and service to China to comply with U.S. export curbs
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters exclusively reported U.S. chip toolmaker KLA Corp will cease offering some supplies and services to China-based customers including South […]

The post Reuters reveals chip toolmaker KLA to stop sales and service to China to comply with U.S. export curbs appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively reported U.S. chip toolmaker KLA Corp will cease offering some supplies and services to China-based customers including South Korea’s SK Hynix in compliance with recent U.S. regulations. The move underscores huge business headwinds facing chipmakers and chip equipment makers around the world, as the Biden administration published a sweeping set of export controls on Friday aimed at slowing China’s progress in advanced chip manufacturing.

The post Reuters reveals chip toolmaker KLA to stop sales and service to China to comply with U.S. export curbs appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals India demands nearly $250 million from Pernod for undervaluing imports
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters was first to report Indian authorities have demanded $244 million from the local unit of French spirits giant Pernod […]

The post Reuters reveals India demands nearly $250 million from Pernod for undervaluing imports appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters was first to report Indian authorities have demanded $244 million from the local unit of French spirits giant Pernod Ricard for undervaluing concentrate imports for over a decade to avoid full payment of duties.Â 

The post Reuters reveals India demands nearly $250 million from Pernod for undervaluing imports appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals Assa Abloy considers selling Yale and Emtek brands to win U.S. approval for Spectrum deal
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters was first to report that Assa Abloy, the worldâs leading lockmaker, is considering options including selling its Yale and […]

The post Reuters reveals Assa Abloy considers selling Yale and Emtek brands to win U.S. approval for Spectrum deal appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters was first to report that Assa Abloy, the worldâs leading lockmaker, is considering options including selling its Yale and Emtek locks brands as it seeks to overturn U.S. antitrust opposition to its planned purchase of Spectrum’s Hardware and Home Improvement. The news comes just weeks after the U.S. Department of Justice sued to block the company’s proposed $4.3 billion deal to buy a unit of Spectrum Brands Holdings that makes security, plumbing and builders’ hardware products.

The post Reuters reveals Assa Abloy considers selling Yale and Emtek brands to win U.S. approval for Spectrum deal appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals General Electric lays off workers at onshore wind unit as part of turnaround strategy
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters was first to report General Electric (GE) is laying off workers at its onshore wind unit as part of a plan […]

The post Reuters reveals General Electric lays off workers at onshore wind unit as part of turnaround strategy appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters was first to report General Electric (GE) is laying off workers at its onshore wind unit as part of a plan to restructure and resize the business. The cuts are expected to affect 20% of the onshore wind unit’s workforce in the United States, equating to hundreds of workers. The company also notified employees in Latin America, the Middle East and Africa about the cuts. The news revealed problems with what is widely thought to be a fast-growing clean energy economy. GE and competitors have grappled with rising costs and supply chain delays, despite the energy transition. 

The post Reuters reveals General Electric lays off workers at onshore wind unit as part of turnaround strategy appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals Samsung, SK Hynix to be spared brunt of China chip crackdown by U.S.
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters was first to report details of the new export curbs the Biden administration plans to impose on Chinaâs burgeoning […]

The post Reuters reveals Samsung, SK Hynix to be spared brunt of China chip crackdown by U.S. appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters was first to report details of the new export curbs the Biden administration plans to impose on Chinaâs burgeoning memory chip industry, part of a broader effort to hobble Beijingâs technological ambitions and military advances. The details included news that foreign memory chip makers with operations in China â South Koreaâs SK Hynix and Samsung â would be spared the brunt of the crackdown.Â The news capped off a number of prior developments on the story in recent months found here, here and here.

The post Reuters reveals Samsung, SK Hynix to be spared brunt of China chip crackdown by U.S. appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
